meta.description: Candidate-controlled landing page that enables employers to evaluate reasoning, learning, and fit through investigation rather than filtering.

requirements.title: Reproducible development environment initializes successfully
requirements.description: Set up a reproducible development environment that can be installed and run from a clean checkout.
acceptance_criteria: Repository installs dependencies using a single documented command
A development server can be started locally
A production build command exists and completes successfully
README documents install, dev, build, and test commands
All commands succeed on a clean machine
verification: Run install command from clean checkout
Run dev server command and verify process starts
Run build command and verify successful exit

requirements.title: Test harness is configured and runs in CI
requirements.description: Establish a minimal automated test setup to verify future features.
acceptance_criteria: A test runner is configured
At least one test file exists
Tests can be run via a single command
Tests run as part of CI or a local equivalent
Test command exits successfully
verification: Verify at least one passing test
Verify test command fails if assertion is broken

requirements.title: Landing page renders with evaluation-focused framing
requirements.description: Create a minimal landing page that frames the site as an evaluation surface rather than a resume or portfolio.
acceptance_criteria: Root route renders without errors
Page includes a clear positioning statement about evaluation
Language avoids resume-style claims
Page content is static and deterministic
Page is covered by at least one automated test
verification: Start dev server and load root route
Run test suite and verify landing page test passes

requirements.title: Exploration path is visible on landing page
requirements.description: Provide visible entry points that invite investigation, even if underlying features are placeholders.
acceptance_criteria: Landing page includes at least two exploration CTAs
CTAs clearly describe future interaction (e.g. 'Ask how I work', 'Check role fit')
CTA targets are valid routes or placeholders
Routes render without runtime errors
Routes are covered by minimal tests
verification: Run test suite verifying route rendering

requirements.title: Canonical experience data model exists and is validated
requirements.description: Introduce a structured, typed representation of personal experiences that serves as the single source of truth for future UI rendering and AI grounding.
acceptance_criteria: A canonical experience data model is defined in code (e.g. TypeScript interfaces or schema)
The model captures: context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned
At least the three existing experiences are represented using this model
Experience data is stored in a deterministic, version-controlled format (e.g. TS/JSON)
The model is imported successfully by application code without runtime errors
The data model is explicitly documented in code comments or README
The data model can be extended without breaking existing consumers
verification: Typecheck succeeds with the new model
Application builds successfully after adding the model
At least one automated test validates the structure or contents of the experience data
Breaking the model shape causes tests or typecheck to fail

requirements.title: Read-only Experience Explorer renders canonical experience data
requirements.description: Expose the canonical experience data model through a read-only UI that allows employers to explore context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned.
acceptance_criteria: A new route exists for exploring experiences (e.g. /experience or /experiences)
The UI renders experiences exclusively from the canonical experience data model
At least one experience can be selected and viewed in detail
The detail view displays context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned
Navigation between experiences is possible without page reloads
The UI is deterministic and contains no AI-generated content
The implementation introduces no breaking changes to existing routes
All rendered content avoids resume-style claims and marketing language
verification: Navigate to the experience explorer route and view each experience
Verify that rendered content matches the canonical data model exactly
Run test suite and confirm new UI tests pass
Break experience data shape and confirm tests or typecheck fail
